\section*{\begin{picture}(20,0) \put(-5,-10){\includegraphics*[width=1cm]{/www/erowid.org/experiences/images/erologo_1cm_600dpi_greyscale}} \end{picture} Erowid Experience Vaults Report Id: 19702}

\subsection*{Vaporized}
\vspace{-0.2cm}
by \emph{gggiiimmmppp}
\vspace{0.5cm}
\thispagestyle{plain}

\setlength{\parskip}{1ex}
\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|c|c|c|}
\hline
Dose:  T+ 0:00 & 1 bowl & smoked & Wormwood & dried\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{1mm}

\begin{tabular}[h]{|c|c|}
\hline
Body weight: & 200.00 lbs\\
\hline
\end{tabular}

\vspace{2mm}
I got 30g of wormwood a few weeks ago and have tried it mixed with weed in a two chamber bong and mixed with salvia in my gravity bong.  It tasted like shit, and only enhanced the feeling mildly.  I would not have tried smoking it straight because of the taste, but from the mild effect when mixed with weed I assumed that, alone, it would not be anything incredible.



I was looking up some information about thujone when I saw that its boiling point is only 1 degree celcius above that of THC according to the sources that google turned up.  I just smoked a bowl of it in my vaporizer (a home made contraption, soldering iron vaporizer/bubbler).  It actually didn't taste bad\ldots  almost a bit like mint.  It was also extremely smooth.



The feeling is not unlike that of marijuana, minus the munchies, giggling, and memory loss.  I am also more sedated than I usually am when I am high.



The verdict: not bad at all considering the price (I got 30 grams online for \$11 shipped) and legality.  Wormwood is without a doubt my favorite legal drug that I have tried to date.

\end{document}
